conclusion: Analyze the ABCDA cycle and use the ideal gas law.
AB is isobaric expansion from (P1, V1) to (P1, V2).
BC is isochoric process from (P1, V2) to (P2, V2).
CD is isobaric compression from (P2, V2) to (P2, V1).
DA is isochoric process from (P2, V1) to (P1, V1).
Temperature at State A is T0.
Calculate TB using isobaric process: TB = T0 (V2/V1).
Calculate TC using isochoric process: TC = TB (P2/P1) = T0 (V2/V1) (P2/P1).
Calculate TD using isobaric process: TD = TC (V1/V2) = T0 (P2/P1).
Final answer: Temperature at state D is TD = T0 (P2/P1).
